entities.name: Mip-Splatting
entities.description: An alias-free 3D Gaussian Splatting method introducing a 3D smoothing filter and a 2D Mip filter for novel view synthesis with improved scale robustness and anti-aliasing.

entities.name: 3D Gaussian Splatting
entities.description: A method that represents scenes as a set of 3D Gaussian primitives rendered through splatting and 2D dilation for novel view synthesis.

entities.name: 3DGS + EWA
entities.description: 3D Gaussian Splatting with an Elliptical Weighted Average (EWA) filter replacing the dilation step to mitigate aliasing.

entities.name: Mip-NeRF
entities.description: A multiscale representation for anti-aliasing neural radiance fields, using integrated position encoding for anti-aliasing.

entities.name: Mip-NeRF 360
entities.description: An unbounded anti-aliased neural radiance field method designed for 360-degree novel view synthesis, based on anti-aliasing and multi-scale learning.

entities.name: Zip-NeRF
entities.description: An anti-aliased grid-based neural radiance field method that improves quality and generalization using multi-scale feature grids.

entities.name: Tri-MipRF
entities.description: Tri-mip representation for efficient anti-aliasing neural radiance fields, designed for scale robustness and anti-aliasing.

entities.name: Neural Radiance Field (NeRF)
entities.description: A method that represents 3D scenes using a neural field and volume rendering for novel view synthesis.

entities.name: Plenoxels
entities.description: Radiance field representation without neural networks for fast training and rendering.

entities.name: TensoRF
entities.description: Tensorial radiance fields using tensor decomposition for efficient representation and rendering.

entities.name: Instant-NGP
entities.description: Instant neural graphics primitives, uses multiresolution hash encoding for efficient training and rendering of neural fields.

entities.name: SSIM
entities.description: Structural Similarity Index Metric, measures similarity between two images.

entities.name: PSNR
entities.description: Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio, measures fidelity between images by quantifying the error.

entities.name: LPIPS
entities.description: Learned Perceptual Image Patch Similarity, measures perceptual similarity between images using deep features.

entities.name: Blender Dataset
entities.description: A synthetic dataset commonly used for benchmarking neural rendering methods, containing 3D scenes for novel view synthesis tasks.

entities.name: Mip-NeRF 360 Dataset
entities.description: A dataset of real-world 360-degree scenes used for evaluating novel view synthesis methods, with images captured from varying poses and scales.

entities.name: Novel View Synthesis
entities.description: The task of synthesizing novel images of a scene from viewpoints different than those seen during training/capture.

entities.name: 3D smoothing filter
entities.description: A filter that regularizes the maximum frequency of 3D Gaussian primitives based on the Nyquist-Shannon Sampling Theorem, applied during scene optimization to eliminate high-frequency artifacts.

entities.name: 2D Mip filter
entities.description: A Gaussian-based filter that approximates a box filter for pixel-sized anti-aliasing in screen space, used during rendering to enable alias-free reconstruction across scales.

entities.name: Elliptical Weighted Average (EWA) filter
entities.description: A Gaussian low-pass filter applied to projected 2D Gaussians in splatting for band-limited output, used for antialiasing in rendering tasks.

entities.name: Nyquist-Shannon Sampling Theorem
entities.description: A fundamental theorem in signal processing dictating the minimal sampling rate for accurate signal reconstruction and avoidance of aliasing.

relationships.description: Mip-Splatting improves upon 3D Gaussian Splatting, particularly for generalization to out-of-distribution sampling rates and mitigating artifacts (aliasing, dilation, high-frequency artifacts) in novel view synthesis.
Mip-Splatting uses a 3D smoothing filter to regularize the frequency of 3D Gaussian primitives, eliminating high-frequency artifacts when zooming in.
Mip-Splatting uses a 2D Mip filter as a replacement for 2D dilation, providing anti-aliasing and mitigating dilation/aliasing issues during novel view synthesis, especially for zoom-out.
Mip-Splatting addresses the task of novel view synthesis by rendering images from new viewpoints with minimized artifacts.
The 3D smoothing filter is based on the Nyquist-Shannon Sampling Theorem, applying frequency constraints derived from input view sampling rates.
Mip-Splatting improves upon 3DGS + EWA, showing better generalization, fewer artifacts, and superior metric scores when varying camera zoom or scale.
3DGS + EWA improves on vanilla 3DGS by reducing certain artifacts via elliptical weighted averaging, though it can yield over-smoothed results at some scales.
Mip-Splatting is evaluated on the Blender Dataset for both multi-scale and single-scale training/testing protocols.
Mip-Splatting is evaluated on the Mip-NeRF 360 Dataset in single-scale and multi-scale settings.
Mip-Splatting achieves state-of-the-art or superior PSNR metrics compared to baseline and previous methods, especially at out-of-distribution scales.
Mip-Splatting achieves high SSIM scores on evaluated datasets, outperforming prior approaches at various resolutions/scales.
Mip-Splatting achieves lower (better) LPIPS values, indicating more perceptually accurate reconstructions vs previous methods.
Mip-Splatting is based on 3D Gaussian Splatting, with modifications to filters for improved aliasing and generalization.
3DGS + EWA is based on 3DGS, replacing the 2D dilation step with an EWA filter for improved anti-aliasing.
EWA filter and 2D Mip filter are both approaches for anti-aliasing/filtering in projected space but use different principles (empirical vs pixel-based).
Mip-Splatting outperforms NeRF in multi-scale synthesis settings, especially for generalization to new sampling rates/resolutions.
Mip-Splatting surpasses Mip-NeRF in generalization and novel view synthesis quality at unseen resolutions/scales.
Mip-Splatting surpasses Mip-NeRF 360 in synthesizing high-resolution and multi-scale novel views, especially for out-of-distribution samples.
Mip-Splatting yields better results than Zip-NeRF in single-scale training/multi-scale testing settings on Mip-NeRF 360 dataset.
Mip-Splatting outperforms Tri-MipRF according to multi-scale experiments in the benchmark tables.
Mip-Splatting outperforms TensoRF on multi-scale novel view synthesis metrics.
Mip-Splatting outperforms Instant-NGP on multi-scale and out-of-distribution synthesis benchmarks.
Mip-Splatting outperforms Plenoxels in multi-scale generalization and novel view synthesis metrics.
